wikipedia_page.main: David Peter Ryan (born 5 January 1957) is an English former football goalkeeper who played his first league game for Port Vale in 1976, on loan from Manchester United. He later played football for Southport, Northwich Victoria, and Chorley.

response: Connaughton moved on to Third Division side Port Vale in May 1974, where he replaced Alan Boswell. He played 47 games in 1974–75, leaving deputy Reg Edwards to play just twice. For his consistency he was voted Player of the Year by the club's supporters. He missed just one game in 1975–76, with Manchester United loanee David Ryan covering him for a 2–1 defeat at Swindon Town on 17 January.
